meanings.definition: Convert (data or information) into digital form.
meanings.sent1: I will digitalise the old photographs by scanning them into my computer.
meanings.sent2: It is important to digitalise important documents to keep them safe and easily accessible.
meanings.sent3: I tried to digitalise my cat's meows, but all I got was static!
meanings.sent4: Her smile was so bright, it seemed to digitalise the room with happiness.
meanings.sent5: The artist's brush strokes seemed to digitalise the emotions of the painting.

meanings.sent1: We need to digitalise our record-keeping system for better organization.
meanings.sent2: Many companies are choosing to digitalise their operations for increased efficiency.
meanings.sent3: I accidentally digitalised my shopping list and now it's stuck on my phone!
meanings.sent4: The new software will digitalise the entire process, making it much faster.
meanings.sent5: The futuristic world in the movie seemed to digitalise everything around the characters.

meanings.definition: To represent (something) by a digital code.
meanings.sent1: The scientist was able to digitalise the complex equation into a simple code.
meanings.sent2: In modern times, we often digitalise our passwords for security reasons.
meanings.sent3: I tried to digitalise my emotions, but they are too complex for a simple code.
meanings.sent4: Her words seemed to digitalise the feelings of love into a beautiful poem.
meanings.sent5: The artist managed to digitalise the essence of nature in his digital artwork.
